post.summary: List measurements for a batch of metrics
post.description:
List metric measurements, potentially filtered and aggregated. This operation mimics the
  capabilities found in GET `/v1/metrics/{name}/measurements`, extending it for an entire batch of
  metrics that can be requested at once, over the same time interval.

  It is legal to request the same metric multiple times, using different aggregations. For
  example, both the total for the interval (scalar) and a time series can be read simultaneously,
  using two different entries in the request payload. Entries in the response can be matched with
  the respective requests by metric name. When more than one exist for the same name, an `id`
  can be provided to disambiguate. This property will be echoed back unchanged and can be used
  for some or all entries, regardless of whether metrics repeat.

  By default, this endpoint will omit response entries that include no measurements. This is done
  only when the request contains enough information for the client to successfully match all
  responses back to their respective requestsâ€”i.e., when there is at most one entry for each
  combination of metric name and `id`. This provides a cleaner response, especially in case where
  multiple pages need to be traversed and data for most metric entries is exhausted early.
  Otherwise, empty entries will be included as well and the output will be fully positional. This
  positional mode can be forced with `forcePositional`.

  Pages can be navigated by following the links returned in `pageInfo`. Those requests must also
  be POST and must include the same payload that was initially sent. Behavior is undefined
  otherwise.

parameters.name: forcePositional
parameters.description: Forces a positional response; see the operation description.

id.description: Entry identification, as (if) provided in the corresponding request entry.

bucketSizeInSeconds.description: Bucket size used for computing points in this entry.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the event in seconds since the epoch. Defaults to the current time.

source.description: Description of the event's origination. For example, a hostname, user, or application name.

description.description: Extra metadata about the event describing the specifics of the event.

parentEventId.description: The id of the parent event

tags.description: A set of key-value pairs that describe the event

links.description: A set of links to related resources

parentOrgUnitId.description: Immediate Parent Organization Unit ID of the AWS Account to be integrated.

selectedRegions.description: String array of AWS Regions in which the AWS Account is integrated.

externalId.description: New External ID generated that is to be integrated as part of AWS Account's trust relationship.

integrationType.description: Integration Type would either be STREAMING or POLLING

isNewAccount.description: Flag to indicate if the AWS Account is newly integrated to SolarWinds Observability under the Control Tower Management Account Integration.

lastReportedTime.description: Last reported time of the metric.

encryptedCredentials.description:
Encrypted credentials for connecting to the database server when using basic authentication (username, password)
can be generated using this command:
./dbo-headless-installer -swoparams=<SwoParamasJsonFile> --encrypt-creds --user=<USERNAME> --password=<PASSWORD>
Use the dbo-headless-installer binary located at:
https://agent-binaries.cloud.solarwinds.com/?prefix=dbo-headless-installer/latest/

user.description: Username for connecting to database server needed only for auth methods other than basic auth

sslEnabled.description: Enable ssl when agent connects to database server

sslOptions.description: SSL connection options, when sslEnabled is true

cloudRegion.description: Cloud region in case of database managed by cloud provider, required for IAM authentication

bindings.description: binding for packet sniffing for sniffer captureMethod (on-host), example: 0.0.0.0:6379,[::]:6379

Public Key for locally encrypting database credentials before using in database connectivity options

SSL mode such as require, verify-ca, verify-full as applicable

name.description: Name for the observed database entity

agentId.description: Swo Agent ID where the plugin(s) for observing database server should run

authMethod.description: Auth method to be used by the agent to connect to database server

captureMethod.description:
Method for capturing metrics from database server: sniffer/poll/profiler/slow-log, ignored for SqlServer and Redis
Sniffer is supported for mysql, mongo, redis and pgsql.
Poll is supported for mysql, mssql, pgsql.
profiler and slow-log are supported for mongo.

configOptions.description: Optional advanced configuration options for plugins, e.g. disable-sampling set to true

dbConnOptions.description: Options specifying how plugins connect to database server

name.description: Name for the observed database entity

configOptions.description: Optional advanced configuration options for plugins, e.g. disable-sampling set to true

dbConnOptions.description: Options specifying how plugins connect to database server, authentication method change is not supported

deployedOn.description: Host entity/entities where database server is deployed on

platformOptions.description: Configure cloud platforms of the synthetic availability test probes. If omitted or set to null, no particular cloud platform will be enforced.

testFrom.description:
Configure locations of the synthetic availability test probes.
  Acceptable values depend on the selected type and actual values of existing probes.

testIntervalInSeconds.description: Configure how often availability tests should be performed. Provide a number of seconds that is one of 60, 300, 600, 900, 1800, 3600, 7200, 14400.

outageConfiguration.description:
Default conditions when the entity is considered down.
  If omitted or set to null, organization configuration will be used for this entity.

checkForString.description:
Use this field to configure whether availability tests should check for presence or absence of a particular string on a page.
  If the operator is DOES_NOT_CONTAIN and the value is found on the page, the availability test will fail.
  Likewise, if the operator is CONTAINS and the value is not found on the page, the availability test will fail.
  If omitted or set to null, the string checking functionality will be disabled.

protocols.description: Configure which protocols need availability tests to be performed. At least one protocol must be provided.

ssl.description:
Configure monitoring of SSL/TLS certificates validity. This option is relevant for HTTPS protocol only.
  If omitted or set to null, SSL monitoring will be disabled and its previous configuration discarded.

customHeaders.description:
Configure custom request headers to be sent with each availability test. It is possible to provide multiple headers with the same name.
  If omitted, set to null or set to an empty array, no custom headers will be sent.

allowInsecureRenegotiation.description:
Allow insecure SSL renegotiation which introduces a security risk in the communication process.
  Checking this option could lead to exposing credentials to unauthorized entities and the possibility of unauthorized access, interception, or manipulation of sensitive data, compromising the integrity and security of the communication channel.
  Available only with HTTPS check.
  If omitted or set to null, insecure SSL renegotiation won't be allowed.

postData.description:
Configure data that will be sent as POST request body by the synthetic probe.
  If omitted or set to null/empty string, the probe will send the usual GET requests.

operator.description: Defines whether the check should pass only when the string is present on the page (CONTAINS) or only when it is absent (DOES_NOT_CONTAIN).

value.description: The string that which will be searched in the page source code.

name.description: Name of a request header. Must contain only characters allowed by RFC: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _.

Name of the URI, which must be unique within the organization.
  The name must also not contain any control characters, any white space other than space (U+0020), or any consecutive, leading or trailing spaces.

availabilityCheckSettings.description: Availability tests configuration for the URI.

tags.description: Entity tags. Tag is a key-value pair, where there may be only single tag value for the same key.

lastOutageStartTime.description: Time when the last outage started.

lastOutageEndTime.description: Time when the last outage ended.

lastTestTime.description: Time when the last test was performed.

lastErrorTime.description: Last time when a synthetic test failed.

lastResponseTime.description: Response time from the last synthetic check in milliseconds.

name.description:
Name of the website, which must be unique within the organization.
  The website must also not contain any control characters, any white space other than space (U+0020), or any consecutive, leading or trailing spaces.

url.description: URL of the website. Must be a valid URL with no leading or trailing white space. Must not contain invalid port number (>65535).

monitoringOptions.description: Defines which monitoring features are enabled for a website.

availabilityCheckSettings.description:
Use this field to configure availability tests for the website.
  You are required to configure at least availability monitoring or real user monitoring to be able to create website.

tags.description: Entity tags. Tag is a key-value pair, where there may be only single tag value for the same key.

rum.description:
Use this field to configure real user monitoring (RUM) for the website.
You are required to configure at least availability monitoring or real user monitoring to be able to create website.

lastOutageStartTime.description: Time when the last outage started.

lastOutageEndTime.description: Time when the last outage ended.

lastTestTime.description: Time when the last test was performed.

lastErrorTime.description: Last time when a synthetic test failed.

lastResponseTime.description: Response time from the last synthetic check in milliseconds.

nextOnDemandAvailabilityTime.description: Timestamp for when the next on-demand check could be executed. If at '0', it means you can execute it anytime.

probes.description: Synthetic probes used to perform availability tests.

failingTestLocations.description: How many locations must report a failure for an entity to be considered down.

consecutiveForDown.description: Number of consecutive failing tests for an entity to be considered down.

active.description: True if the probe is active.

region.description: Region where the probe is located.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country where the probe is located.

city.description: City where the probe is located.

ipv6Addresses.description: IPv6 addresses of the probe. Not all probes support IPv6.

testFromAll.description:
Use this field to configure whether availability tests should be performed from all selected
  platforms or one randomly selected platform. It has no effect if you provided only one platform
  in the `probePlatforms` field.

  If set to true, a separate test is made from each of the selected platforms.

  If set to false, only one of the selected platforms is chosen every time.

  If omitted, the previous setting will stay in effect. If there is no previous setting, the value
  will default to false.

enabled.description:
Whether SSL monitoring is enabled for the website.
  If set to false, SSL monitoring will be disabled, but the other settings will be remembered in case you re-enable it later.
  If omitted, the previous setting will stay in effect. If there is no previous setting, the value will default to false.

daysPriorToExpiration.description: Number of days before the expiration date an SSL certificate will be considered 'expiring.'

ignoreIntermediateCertificates.description:
Use this option to limit the certificate expiration check to only the first certificate in the chain (normally the host certificate).
  This way you will not be warned about impending expiration of intermediate or root Certification Authority certificates in the chain.
  This option does not affect any other certificate validity checks besides expiration.
  If omitted, the previous setting will stay in effect. If there is no previous setting, the value will default to false.

  If omitted or set to null, organization configuration will be used for this entity.

values.description: A list of probe location values of the selected type. At least one value matching an existing probe must be provided.

port.description: Port number to be used in TCP tests.

stringToSend.description: Use this field to specify a string to send in the body of a TCP request.
stringToSend.example:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: solarwinds.com
Connection: close

stringToExpect.description: Use this field to specify a string to search for in the body of a TCP response.

displayName.description: Entity display name / alias. This value is equal to name unless it is explicitly overridden.

createdTime.description: Date and time of entity creation in UTC.

updatedTime.description: Date and time of last entity update in UTC.

lastSeenTime.description: Date and time when the entity has last received telemetry in UTC.

inMaintenance.description: Flag telling if given entity is in maintenance mode.

name.description: The name of the log archive

downloadUrl.description: The download URL of the log archive

archivedTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the log archive was created in epoch time

description.description: Description of the composite metric. A detailed description of the metric.

formula.description: PromQL query to calculate the composite metric.

measurements.description: An empty list indicates no data points are available.

filter.description: Query to filter the measurement values.

groupBy.description: List of attribute names to group measurements by.

aggregateBy.description: Aggregation method used to group measurements.

preGroupBy.description: Secondary grouping, allowing aggregation inside individual buckets. Has to be set together with `preGroupByMethod`.

preGroupByMethod.description: Aggregation method for secondary grouping, inside individual buckets. Has to be set together with `preGroupBy`.

seriesType.description: Indicates what type of data to return.

fillMethod.description: Method for filling missing data points in the range.

fillIfEmpty.description: Asks for filling even if no data points were found in the range.

startTime.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC timezone: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

endTime.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC timezone: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

pageSize.description: Number of items in a response page. Default varies by API.

description.description: Description of the composite metric. A detailed description of the metric.
